issues.description: The template defines singFarmSong() as a void method that prints the song, but the solution changes its return type to String, returning the song text rather than printing it. This conflicts with the UML (+ singFarmSong(): void) and the template’s void signature, and would confuse students about whether to print or return the song and lead to compilation mismatches.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution’s singFarmSong() method signature with the template and UML by changing its return type back to void and performing direct System.out.println calls, or alternatively update the UML and template to expect a String return if returning the song text is intended.

issues.description: The UML and template declare the helper method singFarmSongVerse(Animal) as private void, but the solution changes it to private String singFarmSongVerse(Animal), returning the verse text. This mismatch between void and String return types conflicts with the specified design and would confuse students about the intended method behavior.
issues.suggested_fix: Either change singFarmSongVerse in the solution to return void and print each verse directly, matching the UML and template, or update the UML and template to specify a String return type if the helper should build and return verse text.
